qa_list.question: What is the Master of Science in Intelligent Information Systems program at Carnegie Mellon University?
qa_list.answer: The Master of Science in Intelligent Information Systems is a practice-oriented, professional degree program that offers both advanced study and practical experience in the processing and analysis of unstructured and semi-structured information (such as text, image, video, speech, and audio), mining, and intelligent information technologies.

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of the Master of Science in Intelligent Information Systems program?
qa_list.answer: The Master of Science in Intelligent Information Systems is geared towards students who plan to begin or resume leadership careers in industry and government.

qa_list.question: What percentage of the curriculum consists of coursework for the Master of Science in Intelligent Information Systems program?
qa_list.answer: Just over half the curriculum consists of coursework; the remainder provides hands-on, direct, project-oriented experience working closely with CMU faculty to build systems and solve problems using state-of-the-art algorithms, techniques, tools, and datasets.

qa_list.question: How can students in the Master of Science in Intelligent Information Systems program create their own course of study?
qa_list.answer: Students have the flexibility to create their own course of study in consultation with their advisor.

qa_list.question: What opportunities are available for students in the Master of Science in Intelligent Information Systems program outside of the classroom?
qa_list.answer: Education isn't limited to the classroom. Students can help ensure that our students have the real-world training they need to be successful in industry.

qa_list.question: What communities will students in the Master of Science in Intelligent Information Systems program belong to?
qa_list.answer: As part of the MIIS program, you'll belong to many communities, at CMU and in Pittsburgh, that offer countless opportunities for growth and engagement.

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of the 'Learn With Us', 'Collaborate With Us', and 'Connect With Us' sections?
qa_list.answer: These sections provide information about how students can learn, collaborate with faculty and peers, and connect with various communities as part of their education in the Master of Science in Intelligent Information Systems program.

qa_list.question: What is the 'News' section on this page?
qa_list.answer: The 'News' section provides updates about recent achievements or events related to the Master of Science in Intelligent Information Systems program, such as students earning top honors in a question-answering competition.

qa_list.question: What is the title of the article linked by the 'Read More' button?
qa_list.answer: The title of the article linked by the 'Read More' button is 'Why MIIS?'.

qa_list.question: What is the main purpose of the MIIS program?
qa_list.answer: The main purpose of the MIIS program is to provide students with real-world training they need for success in industry.

qa_list.question: How many communities will a student belong to as part of the MIIS program?
qa_list.answer: As part of the MIIS program, a student will belong to many communities at CMU and in Pittsburgh that offer countless opportunities for growth and engagement.

qa_list.question: What is BioASQ 2016 Biomedical Semantic Question Answering challenge?
qa_list.answer: BioASQ 2016 Biomedical Semantic Question Answering challenge is an annual competition that pushes for a solution to the information access problem biomedical experts face by posing challenges on both biomedical semantic indexing and question answering.

qa_list.question: What did the CMU team achieve in BioASQ 2016 Biomedical Semantic Question Answering challenge?
qa_list.answer: The CMU team, comprising Zi Yang, achieved top honors for their performance in the BioASQ 2016 Biomedical Semantic Question Answering challenge.

qa_list.question: What is LiveQA evaluation track at TREC 2015?
qa_list.answer: The LiveQA evaluation track at TREC 2015 is a competition that pushes for rapid question answering, even to seemingly off the wall questions posed to the Yahoo! Answers website.

qa_list.question: What did Carnegie Mellon system achieve in LiveQA evaluation track at TREC 2015?
qa_list.answer: The Carnegie Mellon system designed to rapidly answer questions received the highest score by far in the LiveQA evaluation track at the Text Retrieval Conference (TREC) 2015.

qa_list.question: Where is the contact information for LTI Webmaster?
qa_list.answer: The contact information for LTI Webmaster can be found in the 'Contact Us' section of Master in Intelligent Information Systems at Carnegie Mellon University, located at 5000 Forbes Avenue, Pittsburgh, PA 15213-3891. The phone number is 412-268-9870 and the email address is ltiwebmaster@cs.cmu.edu.

qa_list.question: What are the options for login and logout in Connect section?
qa_list.answer: In the 'Connect' section, students can choose between logging in or logging out of their account.

Why MIIS?

Learn what makes the MIIS program a unique and world-leading program for professional preparation in the field of language technologies, and how you can apply.

Read More

Read more about Why MIIS?

The Master of Science in Intelligent Information Systems is a practice-oriented, professional degree program that offers both advanced study and practical experience in the processing and analysis of unstructured and semi-structured information (such as text, image, video, speech, and audio), mining, and intelligent information technologies. This program is geared towards students who plan to begin or resume leadership careers in industry and government.

Learn With Us

Our curriculum offers students the flexibility to create their own course of study in consultation with their advisor. Just over half the curriculum consists of coursework; the remainder provides hands-on, direct, project-oriented experience working closely with CMU faculty to build systems and solve problems using state-of-the-art algorithms, techniques, tools, and datasets.

Collaborate With Us

Education isn't limited to the classroom. You can help us ensure that our students have the real-world training they need to be successful in industry.

Connect With Us

As part of the MIIS program, you'll belong to many communities, at CMU and in Pittsburgh, that offer countless opportunities for growth and engagement.

LTI Students Earn Top Honors in Question-Answering Competition

LTI Student's System Tops International Field in Live Question-Answering

A Carnegie Mellon system designed to rapidly answer questions — even some seemingly off the wall — posed to the Yahoo! Answers website received the highest score by far in the LiveQA evaluation track at the Text Retrieval Conference (TREC 2015)."This is the question answering that really matters to people," said LTI Professor and MCDS Director Eric Nyberg, who heads the Open Advancement...
